javamorph
Class CMorphOperator

java.lang.Object
  javamorph.CMorphOperator
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class CMorphOperator
extends Object
implements Runnable

Version:
1.0
Author:
claus.erhard.wimmer@googlemail.com
Program: JavaMorph V 1.0.
Class: CMorphOperator.
License: GPLv2.
Description: Morph the result from left input to right input depending on the ratio parameter.
Hint: Writes the result to the working directory.

Field Summary
private  int c
          Current column of the mesh.
private  boolean f_break
          If true the user forces the morph process to abort.
private  double[][] left_clip
          Polygon clip matrix of the left picture.

          Left input image.

          Mesh of the left picture.

          RGB value of the current left pixel.

          Polygon clip ratio of the current left pixel.
private  Dimension left_size
          Size of the left input image.
private  CTransform left_trafo
          Transformation matrix from result to left point.

          Triangulation of the left picture.

ratio

private double ratio
If 0.01.0 then output is the right image. Every value between them leads to a merged image.

Constructor.

Parameters:
parent - Application's main class.
left_mesh - Mesh of left input picture.
right_mesh - Mesh of right input picture.
left_clip - Left polygon clip matrix.
right_clip - Right polygon clip matrix.
left_image - Left input image raster.
right_image - Right input image raster.
progress - Graphical progress bar.
Method Detail

doBreak

public void doBreak()
Enable abort of the morph process forced by user.

run

public void run()
Thread API. Starts morph batch for a number of intermediate pictures with increasing ratio value.

Specified by:
run in interface Runnable

morph

private void morph()
Create one intermediate picture.

genMesh

private void genMesh()
Make a weighted average mesh depending on the current ratio.

triangle

private void triangle()
Merge all points of a triangle.

merge

private void merge()
Merge (left.pixel, right.pixel)->(result.pixel). Result depends on ratio value & booth polygon matrixes.
